parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To make alive together with. From sun and zoopoieo; to reanimate.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
(a) adj: dead, lifeless, subject to death, mortal, (b) noun: a dead body, a corpse. From an apparently primary nekus; dead.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A falling away, lapse, slip, false step, trespass, sin. From parapipto; a side-slip, i.e. error or transgression.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To save, heal, preserve, rescue. From a primary sos; to save, i.e. Deliver or protect.
